data.enText: death or destruction; any terrible event that you cannot avoid
to meet your doom

data.chText: 她预感到厄运已经逼近。
data.enText: She had a sense of impending doom (= felt that sth very bad was going to happen) .
doom and gloom
gloom and doom

data.chText: 悲观失望；无望；前景暗淡
data.enText: a general feeling of having lost all hope, and of pessimism (= expecting things to go badly)

data.chText: 尽管明显受挫，但对英格兰队来说绝非胜利无望。
data.enText: Despite the obvious setbacks, it is not all doom and gloom for the England team.
prophet of doom
doom merchant
a person who predicts that things will go very badly

data.chText: 认为电视会扼杀书籍的悲观预言家完全错了。
data.enText: The prophets of doom who said television would kill off the book were wrong.

data.chText: 使…注定失败（或遭殃、死亡等）
data.enText: to make sb/sth certain to fail, suffer, die, etc.
The plan was doomed to failure .

data.chText: 这桩婚姻从一开始就注定要破裂。
data.enText: The marriage was doomed from the start .

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

means: 使…注定失败(或遭殃、死亡等)

ex.chText: 他们遭遇了同样的命运。
那个地区的穷人决不会接受被奴役的命运。
ex.enText: The poor people in the area will never accept the fate of slavery.

synonyms.bx: 多指不好的命运，带有不可避免的意味。

ex.chText: 有人告诉她嫁个有钱人是她的命。
ex.enText: She was told that it was her destiny to marry a rich man.

ex.chText: 他相信她来到这个城市是天意。
ex.enText: He believes that it is destiny that brings her to this city.

synonyms.bx: 指将来一定会发生在某人身上的事情，尤指无法改变或控制的事。

ex.chText: 数千居民在这场洪水中丧生。
ex.enText: Thousands of residents met their doom in this flood.

ex.chText: 整个国家都笼罩在厄运降临的气氛之中。
ex.enText: A sense of doom hung over the entire country.

synonyms.bx: 指不可避免的悲惨命运，如死亡、毁灭等。

ex.chText: 该组织许诺要改善穷人的处境。
ex.enText: The organization has promised to improve the lot of the poor.

ex.chText: 搬到这里以后，她似乎对自己的境况挺满意。
ex.enText: After moving here, she seemed to be satisfied with her lot.

synonyms.bx: 指工作、社会地位等所处的境况，尤指不太好的处境。

data.enText: doom and gloom
gloom and doom

data.chText: 悲观失望；无望；前景暗淡
data.enText: a general feeling of having lost all hope, and of pessimism (= expecting things to go badly)

data.chText: 尽管明显受挫，但对英格兰队来说绝非胜利无望。
data.enText: Despite the obvious setbacks, it is not all doom and gloom for the England team.
prophet of doom
doom merchant
a person who predicts that things will go very badly

data.chText: 认为电视会扼杀书籍的悲观预言家完全错了。
data.enText: The prophets of doom who said television would kill off the book were wrong.

example: everyone was aware of the approaching doom but was helpless to avoid it
that's unfortunate but it isn't the end of the world
She was destined to become a great pianist

tr: make certain of the failure or destruction of
example: This decision will doom me to lose my position

tr: pronounce a sentence on (somebody) in a court of law
example: He was condemned to ten years in prison

value.def: Doom is a terrible future state or event which you cannot prevent.

example.tran: 他关于大难临头的警告

example.ex: ...a wicked mermaid who lured sailors to their doom.
example.tran: 引诱水手走向灭亡的邪恶的美人鱼

value.def: If you have a sense or feeling of doom, you feel that things are going very badly and are likely to get even worse.

example.ex: Why are people so full of gloom and doom?...
example.tran: 为什么人们如此沮丧悲观？

example.ex: Attendance figures had been steadily dropping, creating a mood of doom and discouragement among theatre directors.
example.tran: 上座人数一直持续下降，使得戏剧导演产生悲观泄气的情绪。

value.def: If a fact or event dooms someone or something to a particular fate, it makes certain that they are going to suffer in some way.

example.ex: That argument doomed their marriage to failure.
example.tran: 那次争吵使他们的婚姻注定要失败。
